action.action-desc: Mr. Barr introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Crop Insurance Act to require advance public notice of any modification to be made in the terms or conditions of any policy or plan of insurance offered under such Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Creating Crop Insurance Certainty for Farmers Act.

section.header: Advance public notice of crop insurance policy and plan changes
section.text: Section 505(e) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1505(e)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (5) and (6) as paragraphs (6) and (7); respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (4) the following new paragraph (5):

paragraph.header: Advance notice of modification before implementation

subparagraph.text: Any modification to be made in the terms or conditions of any policy or plan of insurance offered under this subtitle shall not take effect for a crop year unless the Secretary publishes the modification in the Federal Register and on the website of the Corporation and provides for a subsequent period of public comment—

clause.text: with respect to fall-planted crops, not later than 60 days before June 30 during the preceding crop year; and
with respect to spring-planted crops, not later than 60 days before November 30 during the preceding crop year.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary may waive the application of subparagraph (A) in an emergency situation declared by the Secretary upon notice to Congress of the nature of the emergency and the need for immediate implementation of the policy or plan modification referred to in such subparagraph.
